description.p: Your patron is a phoenix which has survived thousands of years of pursuit. This being has settled on the elemental plane of fire, and is so suffused with magical energy that its powerful magic can be siphoned through rituals, even on the innermost planes.

tr.td: Positive Energy Infusion, Expanded Spell List, Mantle of Flame

description.p: The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

td.i: beacon of hope, melf’s minute meteors

description.p: Would-be Warlocks who make contact with an ancient phoenix are accidentally exposed to the raw life energy infused into a phoenix’s essence. This change to the composition of your soul causes minor incompatibilities with its vessel. You may roll or choose from the following quirks to add manifestations of this change to your character.

tr.td: You absentmindedly ignite small fires that quickly sputter out.
You cackle like a fiend when you unleash your fire spells.
You admire fire, even if it burns your friends.
You are covered in burns that mark the first time your power manifested.
You are brave to the point of recklessness.
You have a nervous compulsion to keep a bright light in even the barest shadow.
You have an overwhelming hatred of undead creatures.
You fidget and are irritable when you can’t see the sun.
You sometimes become entranced when looking closely at others. You don’t know why.
You sprout needle-thin feathers in addition to your hair, or your scales grow feather-like tips.

description.p: Starting when you choose this patron at 1st level, you can unleash the phoenix fire that blazes within you.
As an action, you magically wreathe yourself in swirling fire, as your eyes glow like hot coals. For 1 minute, you gain certain benefits:

ul.li: You have resistance to fire and radiant damage.
You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.
When a creature hits you with a melee attack, brilliant flames burst from your mantle, enveloping the creature. The creature takes fire or radiant damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

description.p: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. When a creature hits you with a melee attack, the creature takes {{spell-ability:mod}} fire or radiant damage equal.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you attain greater control of your Mantle of Flame, allowing you to create a fiery cyclone around yourself in anticipation of damage. While your Mantle of Flame is active, when you are targeted by an attack, spell, or feature that only deals damage, you can use your reaction to force the attacker to choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This feature doesn’t protect you from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When you are targeted by an attack, spell, or feature that only deals damage, you can use your reaction to force the attacker to choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This feature doesn’t protect you from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, in the face of defeat, your flame knits your wounds and surges outward in a fiery roar.

If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can draw upon the phoenix’s spark. You are instead reduced to 1 hit point, and creatures within 10 feet of you take fire or radiant damage equal to your warlock level + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can draw upon the phoenix’s spark. You are instead reduced to 1 hit point, and creatures within 10 feet of you take {{spark-of-rebirth:damage}} fire or radiant damage.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you can manifest one of your patron’s feathers which sears your foes, heals your allies, and can even restore life.
As an action, you conjure a brilliantly glowing feather in your hand. This pinion can be used once before crumbling to ashes, and you can use it in one of the following ways:

ul.li: For you, it is a simple melee weapon with the finesse and thrown (range 20/60) properties that deals 5d8 fire and 5d8 radiant damage. When thrown, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls. When you hit with the pinion, creatures you choose in a 20-foot radius around the target regain a number of hit points equal to 4d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a bonus action, you stab the heart of a dead creature with the pinion. If creature has died within the last 10 days, the pinion glows with a radiant light for 1 minute. If the pinion is not removed within that time, the creature’s body and the pinion crumble to ash, and in a flash of radiant light, the creature is restored to life as if the resurrection spell had been cast on it. This option can only be used once every 10 days.

description.p: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest. If you have a pinion at that time, it crumbles to ash, losing all magical properties.

description.p: Prerequisite: Ancient Phoenix patron, 7th level

You learn how to imbue your offense with the power of your patron. Once per turn, when you are required to roll fire or radiant damage while your Mantle of Flame is active, you may add your Charisma modifier to one of the damage rolls.

sheet.description: Once per turn, when you are required to roll fire or radiant damage while your Mantle of Flame is active, you may add {{charisma:modifier}} to one of the damage rolls.

description.p: Your patron always watches you carefully, and takes action when the need is dire. When you fail your third death saving throw or are subjected to an attack or effect that instantly kills you, your patron anchors your spirit and bolsters your body. You transform into a phoenix’s avatar, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: You regain 100 hit points and rise to your feet.
You gain the effects of Mantle of Flame, and immunity to effects that change your form.
You can cast hellish rebuke, flame strike and greater restoration at will, without expending a spell slot or providing material components, as if they were cast at 5th level.

description.p: All of these benefits last until the end of your next turn, at which time your hit points become 0. You may then use your Spark of Rebirth if you have not already expended its use. Otherwise, you die.
Once you use this invocation, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Blazing Pact Weapon
element.prerequisite: Ancient Phoenix patron, Pact of the Blade feature

description.p: Prerequisite: Ancient Phoenix patron, Pact of the Blade feature

When you form your pact weapon, its grip becomes covered in down feathers and its metallic parts blaze red-hot. Attacks made with your pact weapon deal fire or radiant damage instead of their normal damage type.

element.name: Grimoire of the Phoenix
element.prerequisite: Ancient Phoenix patron, Pact of the Tome feature, 5th level

description.p: Prerequisite: Ancient Phoenix patron, Pact of the Tome feature, 5th level

Your Book of Shadows transforms into a Grimoire of the Phoenix. Dancing along the cover are licks of radiant flame which are harmless, but warm to the touch. Once per turn when you deal fire or radiant damage, you can create a wave of fire in a 5-foot radius around one of the targets. Creatures in the area take fire or radiant damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

element.name: Bolstered Familiar
element.prerequisite: Ancient Phoenix patron, Pact of the Chain feature, 5th level

description.p: Prerequisite: Ancient Phoenix patron, Pact of the Chain feature, 5th level

Your Phoenix Sprite’s maximum hit points increase by an amount equal to 3 times your warlock level, and it now adds your proficiency bonus to its armor class, attack and damage rolls, spell save DC, ability checks and saving throws.

element.name: Phoenix Passion
element.prerequisite: Ancient Phoenix patron, Pact of the Chain feature, 5th level

description.p: Prerequisite: Ancient Phoenix patron, Pact of the Chain feature, 5th level

You can use your action when your Phoenix Sprite is perched on your shoulder to merge its magic with your form. Your arms blaze with fire in the shape of wings and you a fiery mask with a feather attached to it appears on your face. While in this merged form, you gain the Phoenix Sprite’s fly speed. The Phoenix Sprite’s body becomes dismissed to a pocket dimension, and can be recalled as an action, to end this effect and cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.
